alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 11:34AM MST until July 14 at 2:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR AREAS NEAR PRESCOTT AND IRON SPRINGS UNTIL 230 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...The cities of Prescott and Iron Springs in Yavapai County. * WHEN...Until 230 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flooding over low-water crossings. Ponding of water on interstates, highways and in urban areas will create hazardous travel conditions. Water flowing over roadways will create slick paved roads and muddy unpaved roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1132 AM MST, trained weather spotters reported around in 1 inch of rain in roughly 45 minutes near Prescott. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Agua Fria River, Tonto Wash, Bannon Creek, Woolsey Wash, Granite Creek, Strickland Wash, Little Chino Valley, Iron Springs Wash, Bottleneck Wash, Spence Creek, Skull Valley Wash, Willow Creek, Butte Creek, Mint Wash, Wolf Creek, Miller Creek, Hassayampa River and Lynx Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Prescott, Prescott Valley, Yavapai Campground, Indian Hill West Prescott, Downtown Prescott, Iron Springs, Oak Knoll Village, Prescott Gateway Mall, Williamson Valley, Groom Creek Subdivision, White Spar Campground, Lynx Lake Dam and Upper Wolf Creek Group Campground. - This includes the following highways... State Route 69 between mile markers 291 and 296. State Route 89 between mile markers 307 and 320. State Route 89A between mile markers 318 and 319. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
